name: GawdServer
tagline: A new style of Minecraft server modding.
body:
### What is the GawdServer?
The GawdServer is a new modding API for Minecraft servers.
What makes the GawdServer different is that it is a launcher instead of a wrapper.
This allows you to control the server without ever modifying the servers code.

### How does it work?
Unlike Bukkit, which wrappes the Minecraft server and creates hooks and events in the code;
The GawdServer will instead listen to the server and send the server commands as necessary.

For example, player Steve types into chat **_!home_**
> The server will look for the home handle. If you have the home plugin, the home plugin will lookup the players home coordinates and respond to the server `tp Steve 123 45 678`

### Setting up a Server
Starting a GawdServer is aimed to be as simple as Bukkit.

1. Download the latest GawdServer build from [here](https://github.com/GawdServer/GawdServer/releases/latest).
2. Download a Minecraft server. This can be Vanilla, Snapshot, etc...
3. Modify the GawdServer.conf to configure how your server is launched.
4. Drag any plugin **_.Jar_** files to the **_plugins_** folder.
5. Open Command Prompt or Shell run the following command:
```
java -jar GawdServer.jar
```

### Plugins
To provide some basic functionality and to help demonstrate the API, I have created some basic plugins.
Downloads for these plugins can be found [here](https://github.com/GawdServer/PluginList).
If you would like to have your plugin listed, please submit it [here](https://github.com/GawdServer/PluginList/issues/new).
